===Etymology===
''[[和製漢語#Japanese|Wasei kango]]'': {{calque|ja|nl|dwaalster}} (literally, “wander star”).

Coined in 1792 by {{etyl|nl|-}}-{{etyl|ja|-}} translator Motoki Yoshinaga in his translation of [[w:Copernicus|Copernicus]]'s ''[[w:De revolutionibus orbium coelestium|De revolutionibus orbium coelestium]]'' and its [[heliocentric]] [[model]]. [[Sinic]] compound of {{compound|ja|sort=わくせい|惑|tr1=waku|t1=to move about confusedly, to wander|星|tr2=sei|t2=star}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|わくせい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|わくせい}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=わくせい|astronomy}} [[planet]]
#: {{ja-usex|あの星は恒星じゃなくて、'''惑星'''です。|あの ほし は こうせい じゃ なくて、 '''わくせい''' です。|That light isn't a star, it's a '''planet'''.}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=わくせい|obsolete}} a [[dark horse]]
#: {{ja-usex|政界の'''惑星'''|せいかい の '''わくせい'''|a '''dark horse''' in the political world}}
